conclusion: Analyzing the flow of liquid from points A, B, C, and D to determine whether each liquid stream will end up in container E or F.
Need to analyze how the colored baffles in the middle of the board will redirect the liquid flow from the top entry points to the bottom containers.
Liquid enters from the green entry point at A.
As liquid flows down from A, it will encounter colored baffles.
The first baffle in the path of liquid from A appears to be the yellow diagonal baffle.
The yellow diagonal baffle will deflect the liquid from A to the right.
The liquid from A will then encounter the mint/turquoise colored baffle.
The mint/turquoise colored baffle will further deflect the liquid from A to the right.
Following the path, the liquid from A will end up in container F.
Liquid enters from the orange entry point at B.
As liquid flows down from B, it will encounter the yellow diagonal baffle first.
The yellow diagonal baffle deflects the liquid from B to the right.
The liquid from B then hits the white colored baffle.
The white colored baffle deflects the liquid from B further right.
Following the path, the liquid from B will end up in container F.
Liquid enters from the light green entry point at C.
As liquid flows down from C, it will encounter the orange diagonal baffle.
The orange diagonal baffle deflects the liquid from C to the right.
The liquid from C may then hit the white colored baffle.
Following the path, the liquid from C will end up in container F.
Liquid enters from the blue entry point at D.
As liquid flows down from D, it will need to navigate around several baffles.
The liquid from D will likely encounter the orange diagonal baffle.
